name: Diversion! Air Canada New Livery 777-300ER First Visit at Calgary Airport
description:
Air Canada's new livery on the 777-300ER is stunning! Here we have Calgary's first ever visit from an AC 77W in their new livery, as a diversion en route from Shanghai to Toronto. The aircraft had a 5 hour delay leaving Shanghai and the crew must have timed out, hence the diversion to Calgary for a crew swap. A long day for those passengers yesterday. Here we have Air Canada's oldest 777-300ER arriving on runway 35L with an interesting ATC exchange (they really did call tower that late, no editing involved), and then later being repositioned to a domestic gate, as all the passengers had to deplane and go through customs in Calgary. Hope you enjoy my first shot of Air Canada's largest aircraft in their new livery!

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Air Canada (ACA/AC)
Aircraft: Boeing 777-333/ER (B77W)
Flight Number: AC028
Aircraft Name: 731 
Livery: New (2017)
Engines: 2x GE90-115B
Registration: C-FITL
Route: Shanghai Pudong (PVG) - diverted to Calgary (YYC)
Callsign: Air Canada 028 heavy
Runway used: 35L
Date filmed: May 4, 2018
Local time: 1830
